comment: Professor Green is 15 minutes late to class every single day and didn't grade any of my assignments until 2 days before grades were due. There are many in person "quizzes" given out but only a specific number are actually taken for a grade. This course is not a difficult one just the professor makes it that way.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Green is a very nice guy and great professor. His classes are all lecture-based. There were weekly readings we had to do and were quizzed over them every week. There are only like 4-5 total grades in the course, but they are all easy and he gives extra credit opportunities on all of them! Overall a great professor and an easy class to take!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Let me just say all of my assignments were graded 2 weeks before grades were due. Tests are take home and open note. You have 2 papers to write, one is for completion and another one is actually graded. It's a super easy class but you HAVE to attend class because he does take attendance. Also, there are a total of 15 in-person quizzes.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The tests are open note, and you have a big window of time to complete it outside of class. There is a reading quiz approximately every week. He's a very chill guy. He made the lecture engaging most of the time and entertaining to watch and listen to.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: This is a fairly easy class, but Professor Green uses lots of historical documents, many of these chosen documents and the discussion of the documents during the lecture contained graphic sexual topics. While many other students may not have an issue with this, as a minor (DE student) in his class, it felt wildly inappropriate and uncomfortable.

Derek Green only grades by two different assignments one is a completion grade. He arrives to class constantly late and posts everything late. We are halfway through the semester and I still have not recieved a grade for my stuff or notes while the people who printed it out did get their grades as well as notes. Do not even bother asking for help.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: whoever said he gives out pop quizzes is lying, he doesnt. that being said, he does give out a quiz each week at the very beginning of class, but its one question about a long reading, usually easy and you dont have to read everything. one documentary analysis essay (easy) and primary analysis essay (a little bit harder but still easy)
okay
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Late to class almost daily by 5-10 minutes. Only four graded assignments (two tests, two papers). Weekly quizzes based on the reading assignments, but everything is open note and open book. Take notes from his lecture slides and you should pass. Not the best professor but certainly not the worst.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This was an easy class. There were two papers and two tests. The tests were open-book. He's not a tough grader, but he was boring. The assignment description sheet he uploaded for one of the papers was very unprofessional sounding.
Nice guy, and very easy on grading. Only a few assignments in the course, so make sure you don't fail those, but don't worry. They're easy. Take this course if you just wanna slide by.

This class was very easy, however only 5 grades during the semester. Two papers, one was completion grade, two exams and  attendance. There are 5 quizzes, but they count as attendee grades, and are random so go to class. This class was very boring, but you have to show up to get credit, he took attended every day. Exams were open book, take home.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I know he may get a bad rep because he is very monotoned and the class is lecture heavy, but he is chill, interactive, and caring. Attendance was mandatory, which was ridiculous because it really isn't necessary for a course like this since he posts all the lectures on D2L. Great guy who is passionate though and occasionally hilarious.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Caring--Lecture heavy

comment: He's great if you just need an easy A. I went to class for the first few weeks then never came back. His tests are take-home and open note, and the first paper is a participation grade. The only real grade in the class is the primary source analysis paper due at the end of the semester. His lectures are extremely boring, but it's a very easy A.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Green is one of the more knowledgeable professors that I have had. He is actually a really interesting guy if you get to know him a bit. Talked to him a few times after class & his knowledge of the material is unrivaled. Taught one our lessons from memory after he forgot his material to class. Nice guy and easy A if you put in some work.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Caring

comment:
He was okay. Very boring and the lectures were honestly painful to sit through. Tests were open book and take home which was nice. Pay attention to his lectures and power points and you will be fine. 
Very easy A
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The class itself is pretty easy. He posts exams online for you to print. No lockdown browser but I would recommend taking it online. There is no need to go in person. He is a good professor. My only problem with the class was that there are 5 assignments all semester. So if you fail one, your going to have to make it up. He's not a strict grader.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Took in Fall 2022, very easy class, and professor is very lenient. Was late at least 10 min to every class. 5 grades only including 2 papers (one was a completion grade), participation, midterm and final. Midterm and final were take home with 10 multiple choice and 5 short answer questions you got to chose from 20. Very boring lectures but posts pp
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: who pissed in this guy's cheerios
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Easy class but the lectures can be quite boring and not much is done to engage the classroom. Only 5 grades all semester, one being participation, so make sure you try on your assignments. Overall would take this class if you want an A and will try.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Not a bad professor at all. He teaches the content very well. I just happened to find the class very boring and repetitive, for all you do is take notes off of his PowerPoints. 5 grades for the entire semester, consisting of a midterm, final, and two papers, and attendance. If you're looking for an easier but kind of boring class, this is for you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Super easy class! Would recommend taking him if you want an easy A. Class is made up of 5 assignments. 2 papers, 2 exams, and attendance. One of the papers is a completion grade and exams are take home. Only took attendance once the 1st week. Readings weren't mandatory so don't listen to the others. Gives out extra credit if you print assignments!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Weird guy who makes lots of jokes that aren't funny and make you cringe at best and at worst gross you out. Very easy class and despite him saying attendance is mandatory he hasn't taken it since the 1st week of class. Weekly readings which are just too long to read in the few days in between class you get. Only 4 grades though so very easy class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: He's is very monotoned in his lectures which can make it hard to follow along sometimes. His class has a basic structure because there are only 5 sections of grading each 20%. Syllabus says attendance is graded, but I don't think he's been keeping track since the 2nd class. There's lots of readings and discussions every other class about them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: He is boring and unorganized. It's hard to show up to class because he's so monatone. The work is easy there is only 4 assignments and 2 of which are take home exams. Attendance is for a grade so you have to sit through his class but still easy and light work load.

His class is quite easy 4 assignments, 1 is a completion grade and exams are take home. I recommend this class for people who dont care about history that much. He has a monotone voice and always comes in class late but he states attendance is required even though he hasnt taken attendance since the 1st week of classes. Workload is effortless!
The class is easy its just lectures everyday. The grading is based on a few simple assignments.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: You have very few really simple grades. He even let us take the midterm home. He grades very lightly and gives a free 100 for attendance even if you don't come. He's super funny I definitely recommend him because he understands gen ed classes aren't supposed to be super rigorous. Awesome professor.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Hilarious
